result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory R Zahn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  No contact direct or indirect with Jason G.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Maintain stable residence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cory R Zahn

records.addlTxt: of conviction and order - ERP.    IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days will be determined by a DOC records office staff and will be based upon actual release date.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Email from Dep. Werner in the jail with sentence credit due defendant of 213 days.

Door County Jail Request for Sentence Modification - defendant requests 3 day furlough before beginning his prison sentence. Court denies request. Defendant needs to start his prison sentence and move on with his life.

Defendant Cory R Zahn in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Cory R Zahn in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews factual errors in PSI.  State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement. Defense gives sentencing argument. Defendant makes statement to the court.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 2.   Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. Court dismisses Ct. 3 but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. Court orders CSI.  Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Cory R Zahn in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Cory R Zahn in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
from Atty Reetz requesting to reschedule 4/04/16 hearing because of a conflict. Court reschedules.
Plea hearing on April 11, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant was fingerprinted by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 6/22/16)

No contact direct or indirect with J.G.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Cory R Zahn in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Cory R Zahn in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim.  Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 08:45 am.
